content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #91068 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
I think this may be the most obvious case of unsoundness I've ever seen. Like, the (relatively short) MCVE literally produces random output. I think this is unambiguously P-critical.
Thanks for appreciating the use-after-free demo with a String. I like to use that one, or sometimes a segfault, as a demonstration of (lifetime-related) soundness issues when I find them ;-)
It really does get the point across.

I think the other thing that scares me is that the code is just so short. Like, admittedly it's fairly complex for its length, but still. Most unsoundness issues I've seen aren't this easy to hit (not that I've been around that long). I'm not saying that necessarily makes it a higher priority, just... wow.
Though, looking at your issues, you seem to find a lot of these. Perhaps it's just my inexperience showing.
I remember seeing a really old issue with the same bug, but I can't find it
Like old enough pcwalton and aturon commented
It's the old implied bounds on nested references one I think
@Joshua Nelson Is this the one you're thinking of? #25860

Just found out, this is a recent stable-to-stable regression (on 1.56), so p-critical seems all-the-more appropriate.

Also note that the issue name was changed, so the bot confirming prioritization was completed did not appear in this thread.
